context.title: Add Variable Structure Dialog
context.description: Use this dialog to add a variable and add it to the tree of variable structures.

context.title: Modify JAR Dependencies Dialog
context.description: In Oracle Service Bus, JAR resources can contain classes that depend on other classes in different JARs. Use this page to add or remove referenced JAR resources.

context.title: Alert Destination Editor
context.description: An alert destination is a destination address for alert notifications in Oracle Service Bus. Use this page to configure an alert destination resource.

context.title: Type Associations Page
context.description: Use this page to associate one or more file extensions with an Oracle Service Bus resource type.

context.title: Oracle Service Bus Configurations View
context.description: This view displays a hierarchical list of all your Oracle Service Bus configurations and the projects they contain.

context.title: Oracle Service Bus Configuration Page
context.description: An Oracle Service Bus configuration project is a grouping of Oracle Service Bus projects and resources destined for a server, a location for system resources (SMTP, UDDI, and such), and a container for validation. Use this dialog to edit an Oracle Service Bus configuration project.

context.title: New Oracle Service Bus Configuration Project Wizard
context.description: Use this wizard to create an Oracle Service Bus configuration project.

topic.label: New Oracle Service Bus Configuration Project Wizard

context.title: New Oracle Service Bus Proxy Server
context.description: Use this wizard to create an Oracle Service Bus proxy server.

topic.label: Oracle Service Bus Proxy Server Configuration Page

context.title: Edit E-mail Recipient Page
context.description: Use this page to configure the destination target for an alert sent via e-mail (that is, using the e-mail transport).

context.title: Edit JMS Destination Page
context.description: Use this page to configure the destination target for an alert sent via JMS (that is, using the JMS transport).

context.title: Export wizard - Select Resources for Configuration JAR Page
context.description: >Use this page to export Oracle Service Bus resources to a configuration JAR file

topic.label: Export wizard - Select Resources for Configuration JAR Page

context.title: Export wizard - Oracle Service Bus Configuration JAR Export Page
context.description: Use this page to export Oracle Service Bus resources to a configuration JAR file

topic.label: Export wizard - Oracle Service Bus Configuration JAR Export Page

context.title: Export wizard - Export to Server - Review Resources Page
context.description: Use this page to select the projects or resources you want to export.

topic.label: Export wizard - Export to Server - Review Resources Page

context.title: Export wizard - Export to Server - Select Resources Page
context.description: Use this page to select the projects or resources you want to export.

topic.label: Export wizard - Export to Server - Select Resources Page

context.title: Import wizard - Config JAR Import Load Resources Page
context.description: Use this page to select a configuration JAR to import and an import destination.

topic.label: Import wizard - Config JAR Import Load Resources Page

context.title: Import wizard - Config JAR Import Review Resources Page
context.description: Use this page to select the objects on which you want to operate (create, update, or delete).

topic.label: Import wizard - Config JAR Import Review Resources Page

context.title: Import wizard - URL Import - Load Resources Page
context.description: Use this page to import resources such as WSDLs or XML schemas that are available on the Web.

topic.label: Import wizard - URL Import - Load Resources Page

context.title: Import wizard - URL Import - Review Resources Page
context.description: Use this page to select the objects you want to import. Clear the check boxes next to any resources that you do not want to include in this import.

topic.label: Import wizard - URL Import - Review Resources Page

context.title: Import wizard - Config ZIP Import - Load Resources Page
context.description: Use this page to select a ZIP file with resources to import and an import destination.

topic.label: Import wizard - Config ZIP Import - Load Resources Page

context.title: Import wizard - Config ZIP Import - Review Resources Page
context.description: Use this page to select the objects you want to import. Clear the check boxes next to any resources that you do not want to include in this import.

topic.label: Import wizard - Config ZIP Import - Review Resources Page

context.title: New JNDI Provider Resource wizard - Create a New JNDI Provider Page
context.description: Use this page to create a JNDI provider.

topic.label: New JNDI Provider Resource wizard - Create a New JNDI Provider Page

context.title: JNDI Provider Editor
context.description: Use this page to edit an existing JNDI provider configuration

context.title: New JNDI Provider Resource wizard - Add a New JNDI Provider Page
context.description: Use this page to configure a new JNDI provider resource.

topic.label: New JNDI Provider Resource wizard - Add a New JNDI Provider Page

context.title: Message Flow Design Palette
context.description: The Message Flow Design Palette lists all the nodes and actions you can use to construct a message flow for a proxy service. To insert a node or an action into a message flow, drag the item from the palette to the Message Flow editor. For help on configuring the nodes and actions, click the node or action in the editor, click the Properties view, then press F1.

context.title: Message Flow Editor
context.description: Use this editor to construct a proxy service message flow. To insert a node or an action into a message flow, drag the item from the Message Flow Design Palette to the editor. For help on configuring the nodes and actions, click the node or action in the editor, click the Properties view, then press F1.

context.title: Alert Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use the alert action to generate alerts based on message context in a pipeline, to send to an alert destination.

context.title: Message Flow Properties - Comment
context.description: Use this page to add an optional comment about the item selected in the message flow.

context.title: Assign Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use an assign action to assign the result of an XQuery expression to a context variable.

context.title: Branch Node Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use this page to configure the selected branch in a conditional branch node or an operational branch node.

context.title: Case Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use this page to configure the selected case action in a publish table action or routing table action.

context.title: Conditional Branch Node Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use a conditional branch node to specify that message processing is to proceed along exactly one of several possible paths, based on a result returned by an XPath condition.

context.title: Delete Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, the delete action deletes a context variable or a set of nodes specified by an XPath expression.

context.title: Dynamic Publish Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, a dynamic publish action publishes a message to a service specified by an XQuery expression.

context.title: Dynamic Routing Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, a dynamic routing action assigns a route for a message based on routing information available in an XQuery resource.

context.title: Conditional Branch Node Flow Properties
context.description: In a message flow, a conditional branch flow contains the branches and actions of the conditional branch.

context.title: If-Then Action Properties
context.description: An if-then action performs an action or a set of actions conditionally, based on the Boolean result of an XQuery expression. An if-then action contains an if condition, an else condition, and zero or more else-if conditions.

context.title: Insert Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use an insert action to insert data at a specified location in a named variable.

context.title: Java Callout Action Properties
context.description: Use a Java callout action to invoke a Java method or an EJB business service from within a message flow.

context.title: Log Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use the log action to construct a message to be logged and to define a set of attributes with which it will be logged.

context.title: MFL Transform Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use a MFL (Message Format Language) transform action to convert message content from XML to non-XML, or vice versa, in the message pipeline.

context.title: Message Flow Properties View - Namespaces
context.description: In a message flow, use the namespaces page to see a list of defined namespaces or to create a new namespace.

context.title: Message Flow Properties View - Operational Branch
context.description: In a message flow, use an operational branch node to configure branching based on operations defined in a WSDL.

context.title: Message Flow Properties View - For Each
context.description: In a message flow, a for-each action iterates over a sequence of values and executes a block of actions. Use this page to configure the selected for-each action.

topic.label: Message Flow Properties View - For Each

context.title: Pipeline Pair Node Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use a pipeline pair node to define request and response processing.

context.title: Publish Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use a publish action to identify a statically specified target service for a message and to configure how the message is packaged and sent to that service.

context.title: Publish Table Action Properties
context.description: Use a publish table action to publish a message to zero or more statically specified services. Switch-style condition logic is used to determine at run time which services will be used for the publish.

context.title: Raise Error Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use the raise error action to raise an exception with a specified error code (a string) and description.

context.title: Rename Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use the rename action to rename elements selected by an XPath expression without modifying the contents of the element.

context.title: Replace Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use a replace action to replace a node or the contents of a node specified by an XPath expression. The node or its contents are replaced with the value returned by an XQuery expression.

context.title: Reply Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use the reply action to specify that an immediate reply be sent to the invoker.

context.title: Report Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use the report action to enable message reporting for a proxy service.

context.title: Resume Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use the resume action to resume message flow after an error is handled by an error handler. This action has no parameters and can only be used in error pipelines.

context.title: Route Node Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use the route node to handle resquest and response dispatching of messages to and from business services. No other nodes can follow a route node.

context.title: Routing Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use a routing action to identify a target service for the message and configure how the message is routed to that service.

context.title: Routing Options Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use a routing options action to modify any or all of the following properties in the outbound request: URI, Quality of Service, Mode, Retry parameters, Message Priority.

context.title: Routing Table Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use a routing table to select different routes based upon the results of a single XQuery expression. A routing table action contains a set of routes wrapped in a switch-style condition table.

context.title: Skip Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use the skip action to specify that at run time, the execution of the current stage is skipped and the processing proceeds to the next stage in the message flow. This action has no parameters and can be used in the request, response or error pipelines.

context.title: Transport Headers Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use a transport header action to set header values in messages.

context.title: Service Callout Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use a service callout action to configure a synchronous (blocking) callout to an Oracle Service Bus-registered proxy or business service.

context.title: Stage Node Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use a stage node as a container for actions in a message flow. You can string multiple stages together, to compartmentalize processing logic.

context.title: Validate Action Properties
context.description: In a message flow, use a validate action to validate elements selected by an XPath expression against an XML schema element or a WSDL resource. You can validate global elements only; Oracle Service Bus does not support validation against local elements.

context.title: Message Flow Properties View - Variables
context.description: Use the Variables page to see a list of defined context variables or to create a new one.

context.title: New Custom Resource - Resource Type Page
context.description: Use this page to select the type of custom resource to create.

context.title: Custom Resource Editor
context.description: Use this editor to modify the configuration of a custom resource.

context.title: New Service Account Resource Wizard
context.description: Use this page to create a new service account resource.

topic.label: Service Account Resource wizard - Add New Service Account Page

context.title: New SMTP Server Wizard
context.description: Use this page to configure a new SMTP server resource.

topic.label: New SMTP Server wizard - Add a New SMTP Server Page

context.title: New UDDI Resource Wizard
context.description: Use this page to configure a new UDDI registry resource.

topic.label: New UDDI Registry Resource Wizard - Create a New Registry Page

context.title: UDDI Registry Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to modfy the configuration of a UDDI registry resource.

context.title: New WS-Policy wizard - Create a New WS-Policy Page
context.description: Use this page to select a name and location for a new WS-policy resource.

topic.label: New WS-Policy wizard - Create a New WS-Policy Page

context.title: Outline view
context.description: This view displays a hierarchical view, or outline, of a structured file that is currently open in the editor area. When the message flow editor is displayed, you can switch between the hierarchical view and a thumbnail view of the service.

context.title: New Oracle Service Bus Project Wizard
context.description: Use this page to create a new Oracle Service Bus project.

topic.label: New Oracle Service Bus Project Wizard

context.title: References View
context.description: Use this page to view resource dependencies. This view shows your current selection whether it is in the Project Explorer or the active editor.

context.title: Select a Resource Dialog
context.description: Use this dialog to select a resource, appropriate to the context, that has been created in or imported into the Oracle Service Bus plug-in.

context.title: Service Consumption Dialog
context.description: Use this dialog to select a resource that has been created in or imported into the Oracle Service Bus plug-in.

context.title: Service Account editor - General Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to configure a service account resource.

topic.label: Service Account editor - General Configuration Page

context.title: Service Account Editor - Static User Configuration Page
context.description: Use this to page to save a user name and password with the service account configuration.

topic.label: Service Account editor - Static User Configuration Page

context.title: Service Account Editor - Mapping Configuration Page
context.description: Use this to page to create a service account that maps the user name from one or more clients to user names and passwords that you specify.

topic.label: Service Account editor - Mapping Configuration Page

context.title: New XSL Transformation wizard - Create a New XSL Transformation Page
context.description: Transformation maps describe the mapping between two data types. eXtensible Stylesheet Language Transformation (XSLT) maps describe XML-to-XML mappings. Use this page to select a name and location for a new XSL transformation.

topic.label: New XSL Transformation wizard - Create a New XSL Transformation Page

context.title: Proxy Service or Business Service editor - General Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to specify general configuration settings for a business service or proxy service. This page appears in the New Oracle Service Bus Business Service wizard, the Oracle Service Bus Business Service editor, the New Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service wizard, and the Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service editor.

topic.label: Oracle Service Bus Business Service - General Configuration page
Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service - General Configuration Page

context.title: Proxy Service or Business Service editor - Message Type Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to configure message type settings for a business service or proxy service whose type is Messaging Service. This page appears in the New Oracle Service Bus Business Service wizard, the Oracle Service Bus Business Service editor, the New Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service wizard, and the Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service editor.

topic.label: Oracle Service Bus Business Service - Message Type Configuration Page
Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service - Message Type Configuration Page

context.title: Proxy Service or Business Service editor - Service Policy Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to configure service policy settings for a business service or proxy service. This page appears in the New Oracle Service Bus Business Service wizard, the Oracle Service Bus Business Service editor, the New Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service wizard, and the Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service editor.

topic.label: Oracle Service Bus Business Service - Service Policy Configuration Page
Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service - Service Policy Configuration Page

context.title: Proxy Service or Business Service editor - Transport Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to select transport protocol for a business service or proxy service and to configure transport settings. This page appears in the New Oracle Service Bus Business Service wizard, the Oracle Service Bus Business Service editor, the New Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service wizard, and the Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service editor.

topic.label: Oracle Service Bus Business Service - Transport Configuration Page
Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service - Transport Configuration Page

context.title: Proxy Service or Business Service editor - Message Content Handling Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to control outbound message encoding and attachments. This page appears in Oracle Service Bus Business Service editor and the Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service editor.

topic.label: Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service - Message Content Handling Configuration Page
Oracle Service Bus Business Service - Message Content Handling Configuration Page

context.title: Service Editor - Security Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to configure security for a business service or proxy service.

topic.label: Proxy Service Editor - Security Configuration Page
Business Service Editor - Security Configuration Page

context.title: Proxy Service Editor - SOAP Binding Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to enforce WS-I compliance for business services and proxy services (for SOAP 1.1 services only) and select the selection algorithm to use to determine the operation called by this service. This option is only available for SOAP or XML services defined from a WSDL.

topic.label: Proxy Service Editor - SOAP Binding Configuration Page
Business Service Editor - SOAP Binding Configuration Page

context.title: Proxy Service editor - Operation Selection Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to enforce WS-I compliance for business services and proxy services (for SOAP 1.1 services only) and select the selection algorithm to use to determine the operation called by this service. This option is only available for SOAP or XML services defined from a WSDL.

topic.label: Business Service Editor - Operation Selection Configuration Page
Proxy Service Editor - Operation Selection Configuration Page

context.title: Proxy Service or Business Service wizard - General Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to specify general configuration settings for a business service or proxy service. This page appears in the the Oracle Service Bus Business Service editor, the New Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service wizard, and the Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service editor.

topic.label: Oracle Service Bus Business Service - General Configuration Page
Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service - General Configuration Page

context.title: Proxy Service or Business Service wizard - Message Type Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to configure message type settings for a business service or proxy service whose type is Messaging Service. This page appears in the New Oracle Service Bus Business Service wizard, the Oracle Service Bus Business Service editor, the New Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service wizard, and the Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service editor.

topic.label: Oracle Service Bus Business Service - Message Type Configuration Page
Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service - Message Type Configuration Page

context.title: Proxy Service or Business Service wizard - Policy Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to configure service policy settings for a business service or proxy service. This page appears in the New Oracle Service Bus Business Service wizard, the Oracle Service Bus Business Service editor, the New Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service wizard, and the Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service editor.

topic.label: Oracle Service Bus Business Service - Service Policy Configuration Page
Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service - Service Policy Configuration Page

context.title: Proxy Service or Business Service wizard - Message Level Security Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to configure message-level security for a business service or proxy service. This page appears in the New Oracle Service Bus Business Service wizard, the Oracle Service Bus Business Service editor, the New Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service wizard, and the Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service editor.

topic.label: Proxy Service Editor - Message Level Security Configuration Page
Proxy Service Editor - Message Level Security Configuration Page

context.title: Proxy Service or Business Service wizard - Transport Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to configure transport settings for a business service or proxy service. This page appears in the New Oracle Service Bus Business Service wizard, the Oracle Service Bus Business Service editor, the New Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service wizard, and the Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service editor.

topic.label: Oracle Service Bus Business Service - Transport Configuration Page
Oracle Service Bus Proxy Service - Transport Configuration Page

context.title: Proxy Service Editor - SOAP Binding Configuration Page
context.description: Use this page to enforce WS-I compliance for business services and proxy services (for SOAP 1.1 services only) and select the selection algorithm to use to determine the operation called by this service. This option is only available for SOAP or XML services defined from a WSDL.

topic.label: Proxy Service Editor - SOAP Binding Configuration Page

context.title: Proxy Service editor - Operation Selection Configuration Page

topic.label: Business Service Editor - Operation Selection Configuration Page
Proxy Service Editor - Operation Selection Configuration Page

context.title: XQuery/XSLT Expression Editor
context.description: Use the XQuery/XSLT Expression editor to create variable structures, define user namespaces, use predefined message context variables to build inline XQuery expressions, build inline XQuery expressions manually, and select XQuery or XSLT resources for execution as inline XQueries.

context.title: XPath Expression Editor
context.description: Use the XPath Expression editor to create an XPath expression, which is then inserted into the location from which you launched the XPath Expression Editor.

context.title: Condition Editor
context.description: Use the Condition Editor to create an inline XQuery condition.
